responses.content: Q2 was a standout quarter: Search delivered double-digit revenue growth, AI Overviews serve over 2 billion users, AI Mode exceeds 100 million MAUs, and the Gemini app now has 450 million monthly users with daily requests up 50% from Q1. These experiences run on our Ironwood TPUs, NVIDIA B200/Blackwell GPUs, and a global network that processes nearly 1 trillion tokens per month.

Our AI infrastructure investments continue to pay off: 9 million developers have built with Gemini, the AI Hypercomputer now powers Anthropic and other startups, and we introduced rapid storage/Anywhere Cache to cut latency up to 5x. We also launched an agent development kit with 1M downloads, agent space with 1M+ purchases, and we now process multimodal workflows for PayPal, Deutsche Bank, and BBVA.

Gemini 2.5 Pro/Flash, VOI video generation, Gemini Robotics, and security agents keep shipping fast. AI is transforming Search (virtual trials, AI-powered calls, multimodal follow-ups) and YouTube (AI-powered Shorts effects, Creator ad tools). Firebase and Workspace utilize AI agents internally, just as we encourage customers to become agentic enterprises.

philipp_schindler.role: Senior Vice President & Chief Business Officer

responses.content: Search & YouTube ads both grew high-teens, supported by AI-powered Smart Bidding Exploration (14% more conversions) and demand gen. Shorts monetization now rivals long-form, and YouTube subscriptions (TV, Music, Premium) are scaling via new offers and Pixel/AI Pro bundles. Creator partnership hub and AI-powered ad creative tools are also boosting engagement.

Google Cloud deals over $250M doubled YoY, backlog hit $106B, and we signed the same number of $1M deals in H1 2025 as all of 2024. Flex Credits and deterministic agent workflows accelerate pipelines, while partnerships with PayPal and enterprise users (Cap Gemini, LVMH, Salesforce) showcase the AI agent ecosystem.

anat_ashkenazi.role: Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer

responses.content: Q2 revenue reached $96.4B (+14%), net income $28.2B, EPS $2.31, and free cash flow $5.3B (TTM $66.7B). With cloud demand accelerating, we now expect ~$85B of CapEx for 2025, up from $75B, funded by $95B in cash plus a $12.5B note issuance. We continue to return capital through $13.6B in buybacks and $2.5B in dividends.

Google Services margin held at 40.1% despite legal charges. Cloud margin expanded to 20.7% thanks to revenue leverage and efficiency, offsetting higher depreciation. We forecast continued elevated investments in infrastructure, safety, and product innovation while smoothing expenses across the back half of the year.

questions: How does the evolution of consumer behavior across the Gemini app, AI Mode, and Search (volume vs. monetization) influence your thinking about long-term growth?
Youâ€™re spending $10B more in CapEx while still citing tight supply. How do you reconcile current capacity constraints with the investment pace?
What technological hurdles must be cleared to roll out scalable agentic experiences for commercial queries, and how are internal AI tools improving productivity?
How central are new hardware form factors (e.g., glasses) to the AI strategy, and how does AI Mode behavior differ from the Gemini standalone app?
As AI Overviews drives different SERPs, how confident are you about maintaining CTRs, and how do you expect the OpenAI partnership to evolve on Google Cloud?
How are you thinking about the ad outlook for H2 given 12% growth, and what signals tell you the two-surface (Search + Gemini) strategy is optimal?

operating_environment_challenges: Tight cloud capacity despite heavy investment
Managing macro volatility in advertiser spend
